definition: to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

sentences.english: Only one personality stands out in my memory.
sentences.chinese: 仅有一个人物耸立在我的记忆里。

sentences.english: It is still inconceivably first-rate fun on spruced slopes.
sentences.chinese: 它仍然令人不可置信，一流的山坡上耸立的乐趣。

sentences.english: A dilapidated house stands disconsolately amid the rabbles.
sentences.chinese: 一栋破旧的房子凄凉地耸立在断垣残壁中。

sentences.english: There stands a skyscraper on the island.
sentences.chinese: 岛上耸立着一座摩天楼。

sentences.english: In the dark rise sparsely some buildings, screened① by the luxuriant trees.
sentences.chinese: 一些建筑稀落地耸立在黑暗里，被茂盛的树木掩护着。

sentences.english: At the center of the square stands the monument.
sentences.chinese: 广场中央耸立着纪念碑。

sentences.english: He just cocked his head to one side and stared at me.
sentences.chinese: 他刚刚耸立了到边的他头而且盯著我看。

sentences.english: And in the heart of Ermita, there is the Manila Pavilion Hotel.
sentences.chinese: 而在俄米塔中心耸立着马尼拉亭榭大饭店。

sentences.english: It was a handsome modern building, well situated on rising ground.
sentences.chinese: 那是一幢漂亮的现代建筑，耸立在一片高地上。

sentences.english: The streets are all lined with tall buildings on both sides.
sentences.chinese: 街道的两旁都耸立着高楼大厦。

sentences.english: On top of the hill stands a big pine tree.
sentences.chinese: 山顶上耸立着一棵大松树。

sentences.english: The tower stands clear against the evening sky.
sentences.chinese: 那座塔轮廓分明地耸立于夜空中。

sentences.english: Kwun Yum Shan at Kadoorie Farm, amidst the New Territories ranges.
sentences.chinese: 新界群峦起伏，嘉道理农场的观音山耸立其中。

sentences.english: To our north towered the Crazies, an extension of the Rocky Mountains.
sentences.chinese: 在我们北边耸立的群山是落基山脉的一部分。

sentences.english: A Chinese dragon dance was performed in Philadelphia. This is the Chinese Cultural Center at the Chinatown of Philadelphia.
sentences.chinese: 费城舞起中国龙，这是耸立费场华埠的中华文化中心。

definition: to tower/standing tall and upright (of large building)
tall and erect, reaching through the clouds (idiom); used to describe tall mountain or skyscraper
to stand tall and rock-solid (idiom)/towering majestically/(of a person) to stand up against sb
to stand for a long time
to tower/to stand straight (of person's bearing)
